fields.headline: WS Atkins
fields.bodyText: Main activities WS Atkins provides a range of technical and managerial services to the public and private sector including property management, road maintenance, IT services and other services. PFI as part of corporate strategy Around two thirds of the company's turnover is based on outsourcing of public sector services (figures from annual report) and its move into PFI is a logical extension of this. Highest paid director Chief executive Robin S Southwell (above) was paid £361,000 in 2002. Signed PFI projects 18 with a total capital value of £1020.50 million. WS Atkins has also acted as an adviser to other organisations on seven other signed PFI projects with a total capital value of £4484.20 million. PFI horror story Bridgend Prison. The Observer (8/7/01) reported that the Bridgend prison project in South Wales 'will see WS Atkins, Securicor and construction giant Skanska scoop close to £5m by refinancing a £77.5m loan at a 4% cheaper rate'. WS Atkins - latest figures For full year to end March 2002 2002 Turnover: £880.9m Operating profit: £28.4m Pre-tax profit: £20.9m 2001 Turnover: £711.7m Operating profit: £41.4m Pre-tax profit: £31.2m Atkins report that in 2002, they incurred £6.1m of exceptional costs due to restructuring. · Labour Research and GMB
